climbs.name: Colorado Vapor
climbs.fa: Francois Guy Thivierge, Cameron M. Burns, Luke Laeser, 2003

content.description:
This route is on a buttress at Chute de Montmorency. It rarely forms. We got there during a good year. 
  
 Edit: 
 Climb a corner opened towards the East and a mixed overhang to a belay ledge. 
 The second pitch starts in a left facing corner (mixed) then traverses left on a slab where the ice begins.

up the buttress. see photo.
screws, etc.

Pitch 1 Climb up the ramp or bergshund onto the face, and head up towards the narrow gap, belay in the hole on your left off some trees before going over a small bulge. Pitch 2 Head out over the bulge, passed the low angle ledge and pick from the left or right vertical exits. Warning, late or early season you may punch through the ice for a wetting of your boots into the waterflow below. _______________________________________________ Pitch 1 Grimper la petite rampe ou les blocks de glace jusqu'a la face de glace, la suivre en direction d'une ouverture entre des broussailles, assurez sur la gauche dans un trous juste avant de passer une bosse de glace. Pitch 2 Passez la bosse et la pente de neige puis choisissez le coté de la face qui vous tentes le plus. Attention, il est possible de traverser la croute de glace et de se mouiller les bottes avec l'eau qui coule en dessous. Located on the right of a wide rock face, left of the wide expanse of vertical ice.
________________________________________

Situé a la droite d'un pan de mur de roche, a la gauche d'une large paroie de glace verticale. Screws, rap anchor off trees at the first belay (55m), sling a tree on top for the first rap (leave a rap anchor if none are present).
__________________________________________

Rack de vis, rappel sur sangles du premier relais et du haut de la voie (laissez sangles et anneaux s'il n'y en a pas.

This climbs contains some very short steep section. 
A good one to start with for new leaders. Belays are from good trees.

Start on the very right side on the super wide/large iced slab.
Screws

Pretty simple, find the center of the wide frozen face and head up to the trees above. ________________________________________________ Très simple, trouver le centre de la face de glace et grimpez jusqu'au arbes. Screws, rap station in the trees above.
_______________________________________

Vis, il y a une station de rappel dans les arbres en haut de la voie.

This is the classic climb at Montmorency.

This is basically the fourth climb left of the fall. Start on a steep section for 6-7 meters. Then climb easier ground to the base of the next pillar. Built an anchor with screws. The second pitch climb the next pillar and again easier ground will then get the leader atop of the fall.

Fourth climb left of the fall. A somehow obvious line.
Ice screws

Welcome to some awesome exposure where you better figure out how to communicate with your partner cause the sound of the waterfall is all that you'll hear. Pitch 1 (50m) Head up the traversing ramp until you reach a decent belay stance on screws into the solid wall on your left. Pitch 2 head up the more vertical section, then make your way through the bushes and trees to a rap station or continue on to the base of the tyrolean platform. ______________________________________________ Super classique intimidante avec la chutte a 5m et un bruit assourdissant. Planifiez comment communiquer avant de partir! Pitch 1 (50m) Suivez la rampe diagonale jusqu'a une plateforme en pente passé un mur de roche a gauche, relais sur vis. Pitch 2 continuez de monter le mur un peu plus vertical jusqu'a une goulotte entre les arbres, possibilité de rappel ici ou continuez jusqu'a la plate-forme des tyroleenes. About 5m left of the waterfall heading up the obvious ramp. Descend in the route or head climber's left following the boardwalk to the rap from l'Entonnoir.
________________________________________

Environ a 5m a gauche de la cascade sur la rampe diagonale.
Descendez la voie meme ou suivez la promenade jusqu'au rappel de l'entonnoir. Screws keep a couple for the first belay and bring cord for a thread if rapping the route.
_______________________________________

Vis, gardez en pour le premier relais et de la cordelette pour un albalakov si vous descendez la voie meme.

Probably the next best know waterfall in Canada. This landmark sees hundreds of thousands of tourists every year, it even gets lit up at night! 
 There's been a long irritation with a licensed guiding company who will gladly take possession of most of the cliff for their courses, please be patient and ask nicely if you want to climb on routes they've got roped up. 
  
 You used to be required to register prior to climbing the waterfalls and there were specific rules such as mandatory use of a helmet and no free soloing.
